page.title: 05LAW AND ORDER IN AYLESBURY
page.content: {Law and order} includes the courts, the Police Station and Probation Office. The two {courts} are the Magistrate's court and Crown court. Sometimes in the Magistrate's court matters are too difficult to deal with, so the case is sent onto the Crown court. The {Police station} covers all these places; Aylesbury, Aston Clinton, Waddeson, Wendover, Wing, Stewkley, Cheddington and Ivanhoe. The Police station takes care of lost property. The Police work 8 hours a day. The Aylesbury {Prison} is now a Youth Custody Centre.There are 297 prisoners in the prison.Their wages are 1.22 pounds a week. The probation officer is more like a Social worker, she uses a dictaphone to speak into for her secretary.
